We received an email from the distributor asking if we would like to try out this clutch and post a review. Here it is-

This Clutch-

-is pretty. The heavy gold zippers contrast beautifully with the black crocodile pattern.
-has eight pockets for credit cards and the cards fit well into the slots.
-has two large pockets above the card pockets for cash.
-has a zippered coin pocket.
-has two large compartments for a phone, lipstick and other small items. I have an iPhone 6+ and it (with its case) fit well into one side.
-can be cleaned with a soft cloth.
-has heavy duty zippers that open and close well.
-is made well. The stitching is even and the zippers are made to last.

Overall, I liked this clutch a lot. I was surprised at how pretty it is and the gold with the shiny black pattern is elegant looking. I was also surprised at how much will fit into it. Five stars, easily.

What I especially like about this wallet, is that it is small enough to fit in a regular purse.  But, it is also large enough to carry as a wallet/purse...for the times when you just when you do not want to carry a complete bag around.

I can pop my phone in here, ipod, etc and with all my credit cards, cash, I can walk around places, without having to lug a purse.  The purse measures close to 8" in length x 4" high.  It is patent leather, meaning, it always maintains the beautiful shine.  You can use this formally,  or very casually.  It works both ways.

What is also a good feature is the carrying strap.  This is wide enough, you don't have to scrunch to get your arm through.  When I go into a large store, I always fear leaving my bag, so I just pop this on my arm and it stays!

There are two compartments, with zippers that flow easily.  The zippers have small metal pulls, making it easy to grab!  One side of the wallet is for the credit cards.  Each side of this credit card compartment has slots for the cards,  and.....  two spots to place dollar bills, without folding them.

The other side is where you can place a cell phone, ipod, etc.,  and there is a zipper for cash.

Very attractive wallet, sufficient to hold a lot of cards, and other small necessities.  Review for Product!

Oh Wow!!
Upon receiving this bag and unboxing it the minute I touched it you could feel the quality and ruggedness. It has several ways of attaching the strap and an extra hook on the top for a water bottle or canteen. The material is strong and durable for the long hikes. It also has a handy inside pocket as well. Can't wait for our next hiking adventure to use it!

I LOVE this purse! It is by far one of cutest CC purses I've seen. Most are ugly, plain, or boring. This is very pretty and very well made. I like that, unlike my previous CC purses, that it still holds its shape and stands upright when my firearm is placed in its pocket. The purse set up is nice for my liking. It's bigger than I had imagined. I made one small modification to it. The back pocket by the CC pocket, is very, very shallow. I wanted to use that as a phone pocket. But I have the iPhone 6 Plus which is already huge. The pocket is too shallow for probably most phones. I pulled the pocket out, cut across the very bottom and sewed an old (ugly) piece of fabric to it to extend its depth. Tucked it back in and now the pocket goes to the bottom of the purse. Wasn't hard at all and no one will ever see the ugly fabric or how bad my sewing is because it's tucked back in. Lol. The CC pocket holds a 9 mm Glock just perfect. There is no holster and I was concerned about that since my previous purses had holsters, but it is a very nice and comfortable fit. My ONLY real complaints are that the metal rings adds weight and a noise factor to this purse. The "chains" are noisy and it adds addition weight to the purse, especially if you are carrying your firearm. But none the less, it is a super cute, stylish, well made purse. And I've read on another review for another purse that they were easily able to add more of those metal loops from a craft store to add length to the shoulder straps. Right now I can carry it comfortably without a coat, but I have a feeling it would be a tad too short to carry over a coat. So adding the metal loops is a good thing to keep in mind.
But my most MAJOR praise goes to their CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! We had a small issue and since this is a third party seller, it couldn't be resolved through Amazon. Whoever I was dealing with was wonderful and on top of making it right. We just don't see good customer service anywhere these days and it was really nice to feel like I was important, so they were doing what they could do to make it right and make me happy. THANK YOU for that!!!!
summary: Awesome CUSTOMER SERVICE and I LOVE this purse!

This has to be the hardest item I have ever reviewed on here, and I have made many purchases and written a lot of reviews.  OK, this shirt is beautiful to look at.  I waited about 5 weeks for it, so that was annoying, but I knew it would take a long time b/c it was coming from China.  I have such trouble with the Asian sizing--it confuses me what the US equivalent is, and I even know my measurements.  I ended up getting a 5XL!  I usually wear a large in US sizes.  And this is still pretty snug around my chest which is about 38 inches.  I love the appearance of this shirt--the style is really lovely, and I loved the color selection.  Problems are that it is so fragile--just taking it out of the package, I snagged the fabric on the shirt right off the bat.  There were loose strings and extra brocade just sticking out everywhere, so I had to take the scissors to it to fix that.  In other places, the lacey portion is a bit "holey"--little missing or ripped areas--not super noticeable, but makes me worry.  Got this caught in my hair clip putting it over my head, and it ripped a tiny bit more.  The arms are very long, but I'm 5'7, so not a big deal, but I will need to push up the sleeves when I wear it.  I want to put this on and go out, but it is so thin and delicate that I'm scared I'll catch it on something and it will rip right off me.  So I have to be careful where I wear it, and don't think I can wear a necklace with it (another snag possibility).  Have to wear a camisole underneath, as fabric is so thin it is practically see-through.  So it's pretty, but not practical.  I paid a low price on it, so I don't want to complain too much.  Also, as every item I have gotten from Asia, it had a gasoline-like smell.  I just sprayed some Febreeze on it and hung it out to air, & now it smells fine.  Just wish it was not so poorly made and delicate, or I would buy it in every color.

reviewText: Fit was smaller than expected - quality not as good as Under Armour, but that was expected.

PROS:
1) Best looking Captain America shirt for the price.
2) Very detailed print, looks realistic like in the movie, not cartoonish.
3) Thin, but feels well made.

CONS:
1) TIGHT FIT. I am not athletic so a XXL is just big enough to not look completely ridiculous.
2) The photo on the store page looks much too good, the real shirt is much brighter than in the photo and not near as clear. The chest star, the shield and the stamp on the right sleeve especially are obviously prints on the fabric and not stitched patches like his costume is in the movie. This is a printed shirt, not a realistic costume. I knew that when I bought it, but the difference is striking when you examine it for yourself.

Overall I still loved the reactions I got from people, it's instantly recognizable. Now I just need the surfer abs to go with it.

Is there an option for NO STARS for Review and "Are you Effing kidding me" for size? Because I need those options.

I cannot believe that I fell for it. Too good of a price... I loved the pattern pic though. I went for it, against my better judgement, and bought a maxi dress off of amazon.
First indication of a bad purchase? - the envelope it was packed into is about the same dimension as a kindle. Ummm. My clothes haven't been that little in MAAANNNNYYY years.

Then.... then I open the package and I see what I can only describe as a dress sized for a reeeeaaaallllllllyyyyyy tall toddler.

I ordered a womens 3x.

EVEN with the stretchy middle (which did NOT look that way on the site) this is in NO way fitting me. UGH!!!! Maybe I'll get another, take up stilt-walking and then I'll have a costume for each leg.

Ok, so in my pictures, you can see that my PLUS SIZE women's 3X dress measures less than 8 inches across (so less that's less than 16 inches around) - before stretch, which on this dress is not that much as the fabric is so thin and as transparent as you can get without being naked. So we're talking MAYBE a 20 inch around waist size... for a FLIPPING SIZE 3X DRESS!!!! Ok, I'll play the 'but dresses from china have a a bit of a 'size conversion'. Um, ya think? Ok, so benefit of the doubt, let's play 'that' game. I went to the Sammy Dress website, as it's known for their clothing from china. The maker of this ridiculous waste of money is Mei Li Jiao Yang, and there is no site for them. On Sammy Dress' site, my size chart shows that a dress in a 3X size should be 39.37 inches around. Now I'm no Astrophysicist, but it seems to me that we're missing around half the fabric. HALF a HUMAN BEING WORTH OF FABRIC!!!!

Besides the fact that this is COMPLETELY MISREPRESENTED in size, the pattern is NOTHING like it shows on the page. I've added photos to show what I mean. The entire draw of this dress is that the patterning of the peacock feathers meanders down the body. Nope. Not the one I was shipped. Besides being sized for a tall 4 year old, this has a telltale crap clothing store way of sharply stopping right under where the boobs should be (which I cannot confirm or deny since there is no way I can get this on) and there is a huge 'make you look 10 months pregnant band of black elasticized (albeit see through) fabric.

To say that I'm disgusted is the understatement of the year.
summary: a 3x would fit a tall 4 year old. Don't waste your money!!!!!!

reviewText:
Very cute- my photos don't quite catch that there is a bit of sheen to the skirt, I think the size view is the most accurate depiction.  High-waisted, very full skirt- it actually might be a little fuller than my preference as it starts to seem almost poodle skirt costume, but they did describe it as potentially appropriate for retro 60s theme parties, so no knocking stars for it.  The fuchsia is so bright and happy, I'm actually kind of hoping for a theme party!

It's lined, which was a happy surprise.  I'm knocking one star because of wrinkle issues.  The fabric is such that the wrinkles are severe, this will require a pass with an iron and I hate to iron.

As for sizing, I disagree with assessments that it runs small IF you are utilizing their size chart and not assumptions regarding your "usual" size.

I choose my size based on their size chart, I have a 30 inch waist so I chose size 10 and it zipped up no problem.  While it hurts my ego a little to be listed a size 10, it fell in line exactly with their size chart.  It makes me wonder if they aren't using UK sizing, where it is not unusual for me to find myself a 10/12 while I'm used to wearing a size 4 shopping locally.

reviewText: Great alternative to 160 for new RayBans. Excellent fit

For the price these are great replacement lenses. To be fair this particular frame (RB3447) is a thin wire frame, so it's possible my frames got bent a little when removing the old lenses. The lens color and chrome reflection is identical to the original lenses, minus the Ray-Ban logo.  I did already drop them once, onto a cement floor.  They hit lens first and there it got a small chip on the chrome finish... *sigh* This was a problem with the original lenses as well. You have to be careful when ordering Peace Frog items off the net because many are made differently. By that I mean those licensed to produce Peace Frogs items use different brands of shirts for their designs. Example-I bought a PF shirt from a store that was printed on a PF branded shirt(tag stated PF on it) . I purchased as t shirt with this same design on it from same seller this sweatshirt came from and the shirt brand was Gildan which ran much smaller than the shirt I had purchased elsewhere. Same goes for this sweatshirt. I purchased it in a 3xl instead of my normal 2x because I figured it would run small and it did. I like mine to be a wee bit baggie and not skin tight. I also ordered a different style PF t shirt again from same seller and asked what brand of shirt it was on prior to purchase...it was on PF branded shirt so I ordered my normal 2xl.

Point of all this rambling is....ask what brand shirt its on before ordering. Its ifs on PF brand shirt, order your normal size, if its on Gildan, you may need to order a size up unless you can stretch it out really well as Gildan tends to run smaller.
summary: Ordered a size up than normal and it fit perfectly. It all depends on the brand shirt its printed on so always ask prior

I can't figure out why the zippers on this coat are failing to the point of being unwearable.
It only gets two stars because it was so perfect for what and when I needed it. If I need to recreate that costume, however, I'll have to find a different jacket.
If you're like me, and just need it for a time or two for costume purposes, it should be fine. But if you're looking for something to wear every day, I have some serious doubts about this holding up.

First the overall product: EXCELLENT
This shirt is of excellent quality! The fabric is thick enough to touch but giving enough to stretch (minimally) and is exceedingly soft. The colors are bright and deep with very sturdy stitching with very attractive buttons (etched with the logo) with very few loose strings needing a bit of trimming. The sleeve length is adequate to your normal tailored shirt but when manufactured they are less than a quarter inch shorter but again the length is not even an issue just setting the idea of the overall product. The collar is very sturdy a bit thick but responds well to ironing or steaming as it is not reinforced but simply the thick fabric yet the sturdy fabric holds the collar in place when unbuttoned.

Second the sizing: HARD TO GET BUT AMAZING WHEN ITS RIGHT
My first order I followed the direction "two sizes larger than your normal purchased shirt" which I understood as I have had many disasters ordering from other online stores which will remain nameless (but I wll tell you their name is a combination of a public place to keep animals and a flower) of sizing with measurements provided but your final product won't even fit your preteen brother...so I ordered two sizes too large...when I received the product it was in fact two sizes too large for me. I like my button up shirts on the slimmer side even when they are not buttoned up as I am in front of many people on a Daily basis and I gots to look good (sorry for the euphemism but it's the most apt description of how I need to look). But when looking at their ordering advice it stands true...if you want a shirt that fits off the rack and has a good bit of room in it then follow directions however for us taller slimer rockers (6'1" at 160lbs) your standard size should suffice for the slim and sleek look (even with the tagging altered from normal sizes). now as I ordered the XL I could tell its was a tad smaller than your standard US made XL but again by a very small amount. The length is perfect for tucking in and just long enough to leave flowing. The collar feels normal for US sizing and feels good when buttoned.

If it's a work shirt: 2 Sizes up (Standard)
If it's a casual shirt: 1-2 sizes up (Per preference Normal-Slim)
If it's a statement shirt: Standard Size-1 size up (Preference Slim to Slender)

Overall:
I had to return my first purchase as I have been looking for this shirt for some time and standard shirts off the rack were terrible from every store I visited (disappointing). I am OVERLY impressed with this product and the seller and will continue to purchase from This company as long as they remain in business. I have very STRICT tastes and it is rare for me to fall in love with clothing unless it looks absolutely perfect on me in every aspect. If you have any questions I can answer them to the fullest and hope you are just as pleased with the purchase as I am.

KEEP MAKING THEM APTRO ILL KEEP BUYING THEM!!!

reviewText:
These 100% cotton shirts wear well as both under-the-belt undershirts and as over-the-belt outer shirts.  In the latter option, I recommend upsizing by one, e.g., from size L to XL, for extra waist comfort or a roomier fit. These shirts launder easily but expect some slight shrinkage to occur.

I've rated them as "somewhat small" for product fit because men with athletic builds may find them fitting "tight" in the armholes and sleeves. This is another reason to upsize unless a tight fit is comfortable.

These shirts are offered in a variety of attractive color options that complement  a variety of casual jean colors.  These are my first choice for  versatile summer wear and also mix well with a variety of long-sleeve shirts for cooler seasons.
summary: An Attractive and Versatile Shirt for all Seasons

reviewText:
Let me start by saying this is a beautiful bag! It is good quality leather, very well-made with gorgeous details. The matching wallet is slender, has its own carry strap for when you want to travel light, and it is a total bonus for this price.

There are just a couple of things that could functionally be better. The description says the purse is 12"w x 9"h, which it is when measured to the top of the scalloped top. But the main zipper closure is 3 1/2" below the top of the scallop, making the actual storage area of the purse much smaller, really only 5 1/2" high. (Note to the manufacturer that the zipper really doesn't have to be that far down. It could be at least another 1 1/2" closer to the top to give more capacity without sacrificing the appearance.)

The outside cell phone pocket is too shallow to comfortably accommodate today's smartphones.

The gun compartment is amply sized to accommodate my compact semi-auto pistol. However, it lacks a holster and the soft inside lining allows for too much movement. So I used a velcro-sided holster from another bag to add structure but will have to add some loop velcro to the lining of the compartment so it stays put when drawing.

Again, this is a gorgeous, well-made bag with just a few functional flaws. I still love it and get lots of compliments!
summary: Gorgeous, well-made bag with just a few functional flaws

This dress was a bad fit for me.  I am pear shaped.  Because the measurements listed only stated the waist & bust measurements, I assumed (wrongly) that the bottom half had a bit more room than the top.  This dress is straight from top to bottom.  So, if you purchase by your bust measurement, and you're bottom heavy, this will look bad or fit snugly.  Unless I got one that was poorly sized, I would disagree with people saying in ran large.  The size small fit my top half perfectly, and I fall right in the size range according to the listed measurements.  Perhaps those that thought it ran large are large busted, and the bottom half was too big?  I was also not thrilled with the light purple color I bought, it was a muted shade and didn't suit my skin tone.  One final note- if this is a tighter fit on you, it shows every little imperfection.  It's that kind of fabric that requires smoothers or a fit body underneath.  On the plus side, it's really soft and comfortable.
summary: Not for pear shapes or curvy bottom girls

reviewText: Love it! Bought it for my husband to wear during deployment so he could leave his real ring at home, and I think this is the one he'll wear even after he returns. He likes this one so much more. He often complained about the weight of his wedding ring, and the discomfort. This is lightweight, but still visually appealing. Plus, for the price, it doesn't matter if he loses it during a deployment or in the field, and we can keep the ring with sentimental value safe at home.

As a frequent gym goer, this thing has been such a blessing. My tungsten carbide ring was tearing the crap out of my hands whenever I lifted heavy, even while wearing gloves. I hate the feeling of putting my ring in my pocket incase I lost it, so I started looking for alternatives and found this.

Fit - A tad small. I would order .5 size up. If you're a 9.5, go with a 10.
Function - It's a silicone ring. It stays on my finger, and hasn't degraded over time with lifting, oil, rope climbs, pull ups, gas, etc. It's a keeper.
Finish - It's not a fashion piece, it's a function piece.
It's a good ring for the price. The idea was to replace my husband's wedding band while working because he was damaging it. The silicone ring is durable and worth it.
summary: It's a good ring for the price

Top line: Nice fitting wide ring; Made my finger pruney when worn for several days straight.

Good: If you like wide rings, this one is pretty good. Fit was spot on and held it's shape through several months of use.

Bad: Doesn't breathe particularly well, and if worn for many days in wet conditions, may cause a condition I have dubbed "trench finger" (take a look at my pic). Taking it off during sleep can prevent this. It's also a little thick for my tastes--not just wide on your finger, but the thickness of the band material is a little bit much.

Other: I ended up buying a skinnier (aka women's version) of this ring to replace this wide one. The women's version is much more prone to stretching over time, and would have to be replaced more often that this model. So the wide model has that working for it!
summary: Be sure to take it off every once in a while

reviewText: Everything I hoped for! So beautiful!!!!

This dress is not the same as the photos.  It is made out of a stretchy t-shirt material and it is a BODYCON dress.  Not shift dress shaped at all.  A shift dress is typically a straight, loose style; sometimes it is somewhat tighter at the top and looser at the bottom (trapeze).  This dress was neither.  I am typically a size 8, or a medium to large in dresses, and I ordered the largest size available in this dress, which I think is an XL.  It fit similar to a small or maybe a medium.

The gold chains on the back were like necklace chains.  They did not appear to be the same size or weight as shown in the photo.  They attached to the rest of the dress via several "lobster claw" necklace chain clasps.  It literally looked like they had used necklaces as straps.

Overall, this dress was not that ugly.  It would probably be fine for a night out clubbing.  But it was poorly made and looked nothing like the photos, so I returned it.  Would not buy again.
summary: Not the same dress as the photos

My biggest concern is the latch on the top. It doesn't really seem like it will stay shut. But for how cheap the suit is I might just rig something. All in all for the price it worked out really well. It's always a risk when buying a bikini set because women's tops and bottoms tend to vary. You can get this suit by Monif C for about $100 and you can order separates.

I ordered this suit in a 3x because I typically wear between a 1x and 2x. The bottoms fit snugly, but I don't think the top wouldn't have fit anything larger than a C cup. The clasp also did not stay closed and kept rotating, which was very uncomfortable. I tried the suit on, but I will not be wearing it. Unfortunately, I cannot return it since Amazon still shows the suit as "in transit" and not due for delivery for another 2-4 weeks. I am very disappointed with this suit. Save your money and buy a nicer one, especially if you're busty.

This is such a cute Winkine Fashion Lip Crossbody Evening Bag.  This is very adorable and looks just like it is pictured.  Although it is for a purse, I use it for a make-up bag that sits on my make-up vanity in my beauty room.

The purse itself is a shiny vinyl material and stitched really nicely and well.  It is shaped just like lips and is red.  You unzip the purse and you have a big opening with a little pouch in the inside.  It also came with a gold chain to attach to the purse.

The zipper, zips with ease and nicely every time( a great quality to have).  You can also take the gold chain off and carry it has a hand bag.  It does have a wrist-let strap on the side as well.

I think this is a cute purse and has great character and is made well.  I completely recommend it.  I did receive this at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion.  Compensation of any kind is never accepted in exchange for a positive review. All opinions expressed are my own and not edited by any companies mentioned.

It's big enough to hold a regular size wallet, and makeup and an iphone.  It has two options for the chain, one is the long gold colored linked chain, and the other is a matching red clutch that is only as long as your hand.  I think it's made of some sort of vinyl, it's easy to clean, will not get dirty, and seems to be a fun accent.

I was gifted with a sample for a review.  IMO, the only think I'd change is that if they made a small Velcroed pouch inside the lips - big enough to hold a lipstick, or something, it would be impossibly cute, as it is, it ranks 'very' on the cutness scale. This would make a great gift for a teen/young adult.
summary: A Fun Accent Piece For Your Wardrobe

Received free for my honesy review.

This is such a cute and quirky handbag.  It's more of a clutch really than an actual handbag.  It's just big enough for a lady to carry around her essential items on a night out on the town.  It fits my iphone 5S perfectly with space for female hygiene items and your favorite lipstick and perhaps a couple of other essential makeup items needed for touch ups.

The clutch comes with a removable chain to wear crossbody style as well as a wristlet strap that can be added or removed per your preference.  The material is similar to a patent leather material.

Overall, this is a super cute little purse.  Super quirky in style.  It is made pretty well, although I wouldn't want to put it through a lot of wear and tear for fear that it may tear up, but it should be completely able to handle normal wear and tear of normal usage.

reviewText: Great bag for the price

I received a free item to review.

The backpack is a lot more attractive than I expected. The faux-leather surface has a convincing 'slightly worn' character that's neither overly glossy (and cheap-looking) nor completely dull and flat. It's a kind of 'dressy backpack' that I think both men and women would be comfortable wearing on occasions where appearing too casual may be a concern. It's quite light when empty and feels well-balanced when strapped on.

The 3 1/2" zipper handle loops make open/close really easy, especially when reaching over your shoulder. The zippers have a smooth sliding action (I like to rub a little candlewax on them to keep it that way). There's also plenty of clearance along the sides to avoid jamming with the main pack material. The velcro strips on the large main flap and inner compartment divider are great ideas.

The support pads on the shoulder straps don't have much padding but I don't think this bag is designed to be stuffed with overly heavy loads. It's quite comfortable enough for a tablet rather than a larger, heavier laptop. I wish the carry handle on the top were both wider - my large hands feel a bit cramped - and had more padding. There are times when there's no choice but to carry a backpack and that handle needs to feel both secure and comfortable.

The main pounch itself appears from the outside to be pleated but it actually isn't, or at least not much. The small side pouches are perhaps useful for stuffing a pen, comb or brush in, but not much else - too hard to reach down into.

Bottom Line: An attractive pack suitable for 'more than casual' occasions and appropriate for light to moderate loads.
summary: Looks Stylish / Good For Light Loads

reviewText:
(Disclaimer - My wife and I were invited by the seller to try and review their products. We only agree to these requests when it's something we would actually use. The fact we received them for free has no bearing on our review, and we have written negative reviews in the past for products we were sent for free. But we tend to accept more review invitations for quality products, so that's why many of these invited reviews have high ratings. Also, for this type of invited review, we always begin with a disclaimer.)

If you want to use this backpack for laptops or tablets, it doesn't provide enough cushion protection, so you're better off using it to carry other things that aren't as fragile.

The craftsmanship is shoddy. My wife had to cut several loose threads from the bad sewing, and the vecro was crooked and the two parts didn't even match in position, so she had to remove them, realign them, and then sewn them back. When's the last time you had to do that with a backpack?

There are no compartmentalized pockets of different sizes that hold individual items like pens, flash drive, keys, phones, etc. You only get one basic open pocket that cannot be sealed.

The zippers are terrible too. They are very rough and do not glide smoothly, and they get caught by the front lip of the backpack's interior constantly, so you have to make an extra effort to clear the zipper's path of that front lip in order to pull the zipper all the way to the closed position.

Overall, it's a disappointing backpack. We just throw it in the backseat of our car and use it to to hold a couple of spare shirts, an umbrella, and a little first aid box. There's no way we would ever travel with this backpack.
summary: Waterproof and light, but shoddy craftsmanship and design

These are very attractive tights/ panty hose.  They are very light weight and take up very little room in my dresser drawer and, most importantly, in my suit case (which is actually a back pack as I like to travel very light).  At first I wasn't sure about the less- than- snug fit I am used to in nylons or tights, but after wearing them for an entire evening, I realized that not only does this contribute to their comfort but this also helps keep the pattern straight, which doesn't always happen on a large- weave print in hosiery.

I got these in black and they are a nice dark black so they will be perfect for almost everything I wear.  The seam on the toes is a bit heavy, but I realized how important this is on this weave after the evening of wear because my toes would other wise poke through the large weave.  I wore closed toed shoes, so I am not sure how an open toed shoe would work with that seam.  I'll give it a try and see how it turns out.

I only docked one star because the waist band is a bit loose.  This probably should not be a big surprise because they are not by any means a control- top fit, but they are not advertised to be either. That being said,  I did not have any trouble with them sagging, which was my concern.

All in all, I do like these and I am considering purchasing them in a nude tone as well, they are so lovely.

This product was purchased at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.
summary: Beautiful Pattern, Light Weight and Attractive

When I saw this lovely Tang Dynasty floral print short chiffon robe, with its soft satin trim and matching nightgown was available in PURPLE, I just knew I had to buy it. Fast forward two days later (ordering through my Amazon Prime account), and I'm delighted to see that it looks just like the Amazon online catalog page's image provided. It's actually more of a soft lavender shade, than purple, but is exactly as pictured.

Fortunately, for one of my "twenty-something" year old daughters, it will make a lovely gift. Unfortunately, for me, this 'oh so pretty' kimono-style short robe and nightgown set is far too small (and admittedly too sheer) for my "50-something" year old figure and middle-aged sense of modesty.

Otherwise, I'm very pleased with this sleepwear set by the TD DESIGN Company. I recently accepted the opportunity to purchase it, at a company discount, in exchange for my fair and unbiased review. I wouldn't hesitate to purchase another for my other daughter, perhaps in one of their other patterns and color choices, at full retail price, based upon my pleasant first-time experience in ordering this particular robe and nightgown.
summary: A Bit Too Small & Sheer For Me, But It Will Make A Lovely Gift For My Daughter!

I might be going senile early, but I have found that I have lost things much more when using this bag - maybe because it does not have compartments, or the zip opens or I don't know. I do like how it screws up into a ball and it is comfortable on my back. I use it for trips to the store or as a day bag when travelling. It's not that good for carrying a laptop - it's not rigid enough to hold its shape.

It is worth the price for a fold up backpack, but after a month or so of use, the straps are starting to tear off.  I'm not carrying heavy weights, but I use it when I walk to the store.  I gave it a three because that is my honest opinion, it isn't bad, but I'm not thrilled with the backpack either.
summary: Good for light use or emergency backup, but not strong enough for daily use.

reviewText: Very light. Durable. Perfect!

This is a great travel backpack. It folds into it's own zippered pouch, which is actually part of the backpack itself, so there's nothing extra to keep up with. Unlike some others I've tried, this one is very easy to refold into the pouch. Folded away it is so small that it's easy to pack in your bag or purse until you need to pull it out to use. It's a great size for a day hike, or reusable shopping bag, too. Seems wellmade, zippers operate smoothly and the fabric seems like it will hold up well.
summary: Great travel or day hike backpack

reviewText: Good quality and plenty of room, comfortable straps.  Great to bring with you while traveling for days trips.

This is a wonderful backpack especially because it is so light.  It is perfect for carrying my watercolors and it folds up really tiny.  I am sorry I previously gave not a very good review...that was before I used it and compared it to my other backpacks.  Great price too.

This little backpack is excellent for taking a quick hike during the day. It is smaller, and lightweight, not suited for carrying a large quanity, nor a heavy load.

On the outside is one large pocket in the bottom, centered. This is large enough to put in the items for which you might want quick access. On each side, there is a small, but deep pocket which works well to carry drink containers such as a coffee carafe, or a bottle of water.

The backpack splits open about two thirds of the way. This makes it easy to put in larger items, such as a heavy jacket, etc. There is also a very small pocket on the inside at the very top which would make a great place for things like keys, wallet, etc. This is a secure place, but accessible.

This is definitely a very light weight backpack, there isn't any padding to protect electronics like a camera or computer.

Construction is durable, made out of a material that won't absorb water quickly. And if it does get wet, won't be harmed.

The fit and feel is great. Slipping it on, walking around with it, is very comfortable. If it is a day hike, you likely don't' want anything heavy, and this fits the bill.

I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. All photos and opinions are my own.

After reading multiple Meilun Dress reviews regarding fabric and sizing, I opted to go with the medium, which was a great choice. The dress is very well made and the fabric is substantial (albeit heavy). I was concerned with the fit as I generally wear a 2/4/XS in most dresses and although a Small would have probably fit, I am glad I purchased the Medium. Similar to another Meilun dress I purchased, this dress definitely hugs your figure and the medium allows me to move around with relative comfort. A few things to note. I will probably have to insert some form of cutlets, inserts at the chest area. The chest has light cupping and molded forming that I felt that for someone as flat chested as I am, that a little lift/help from some inserts may just fill the chest area lend some balance to the fluted bottom. The fit at the chest is just a tiny bit loose for me, however for anyone with a B cup or above, this probably will not be a problem. I will probably get a few stitches places along the seam under the armpits just for my own personal security (the dress does have some "sticky" support on the interior side of the top of the dress).
summary: Beautiful, Well Made Dress - Beats Paying $350 for Bandage Dress at BCBG

I have always worn a two-piece bathing suit, but became a bit self conscious after I gained my motherhood stripes, aka stretch marks.  After getting stretch marks, I looked into high waisted swim suites but hadnt actually purchased any because I was afraid that I wouldnt like how it looked on me.  I bit the bullet and finally purchased this one and Im so glad I did!!  I love everything about this swim suit; it fits great, it covers all of my stretch marks and it makes me feel great!  I love the variety of colors/styles offered and the price point is great, something I couldn't pass up!  The quality of the swim suit is pretty good, nicely stitched, just like anything you would purchase from a shopping mall.  The leg holes may be a little tight, but a slight stretch will loosen it up a bit.  I highly recommend reading through the reviews to get a good sense of what size to order, it definitely helped me figure out what size to order.  I am 55 and about 135 pounds, I ordered a size Large and it fits perfectly.  I would highly recommend this swim suit to anybody looking for a high waisted swim suit, don't pass it up!  I love it so much; Ill definitely be buying again in a different color/style!

I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I love these retro bathing suits so much, I ordered another one.  They fit great, look classy and make me feel like million bucks.  I told my girlfriends about them, sent them pictures and now they all ordered one for their selves as well.  Not only are they cute suits, but they are comfy to wear as well.  I highly recommend this bathing suit if you are full figured or any figure!  I cant get enough of them, I think I am going to order another one TODAY!

***Photo update***
So I decided to take a few photos to show what I'm talking about as far as size. the photos with the black top is me wth a bra on, a 36C size danskin bra. note the tag size in the top of the swimsuit in the 3rd photo 2XX that is ridiculous, in the 4th and 5th photos with the swimsuit top on notice how it has zero coverage on the sides unlike the product photo shown (see model). Like I said I am a size 8-10 in a swimsuit, in the US that translates to a MEDIUM, maybe a large at most depending on the bust. I ordered based on my measurements for this swimsuit, the bottoms fit fine and the top is crap. I've still not heard anything back from the company and emailed them the day I received the swimsuit to find out about exchange/return.

I really love the swimsuit and have been looking for this swimsuit for ever. however, I followed the size chart to a T. I wear a size 8-10 in a swimsuit, so I ordered a 10-12 (as I figured this was made in china), I received this suit today and lets just say my daughter in law who wears a size 2 just barely fits in the top.

The image of the model is deceiving, it appears her breasts are larger and the top has a more fuller coverage than it does. In order for me to be able to buy this swimsuit I will have to purchase this at a size 5x yes a 5X. that is completely NOT true to size --it's bad enough that a 10-12 is considered a 2x for this brand... I have processed for a return/refund, however amazon would let me do for an exhange as I wanted. I want the correct size, not my money back I WANT the correct size swimsuit.

I'm sorry, but I will not be putting images of myself in this swimsuit online as it will violate TOS because I will be showing too much nakedness, and likely a nipple.

*I received this product at a discount for my unbiased review. As a mom, and grandmother, business owner myself, I will never endorse a product, that I do not use myself, find safe, or that does not meet my high expectations as I find that morally and ethically wrong to write a praising review for an inferior product. I take my role as a reviewer very seriously, I depend on reviews to make purchases for my family, so I promise that you will always get a 100% honest opinion from me, good bad or otherwise.
summary: Sizes are VERY VERY VERY wrong. Add a minimum of 3 sizes to your size for US customers

reviewText: my wife looks great

I'm usually a size 10/12 (L) and took the advice of the reviews and got an XXL. The bottoms fit good around the waist and belly any bigger it might fall off of me. The leg openings are tight. Might need to stretch them out. The front of the bottom has pleats that helps hide middle section insecurities and it's lined. The back is not lined. I tried it on with black underwear and you definitely could see it. I got this in the ROSE RED (looks like hot pink)! Love the color. I'm considering getting it in black also! The top is still a little small still for me. I am a 38DD so my sides are exposed and my cleavage will def be out there. But I'll wear them. They are slightly padded, can't remove the padding but it's good to know they will be lined. I might use a different top I have if I find it uncomfortable. I won't use these in the ocean or pool until two weeks from now, so I'll do an update later if need be. Fast shipping and good quality for the price! Order 2 sizes bigger!
summary: Comfy and good bottom coverage! Order two sizes bigger!

reviewText: Does not look like the picture at all... It's clearly not the same product

For reference, I am 5'9, 36DD, and fit comfortably in size 8-10 pants. The bottoms were so so cute you guys. So flattering. HOWEVER, the top was ridiculously small. Half my boob was falling out the sides! I really wish this bathing suit worked, but unfortunately I can't wear it without revealing myself to the world. The top also came with small holes in the straps so I will be returning it. If you have a large chest, BEWARE. You will have to order two suits to fit yours needs.

This review is written by my wife:

I really liked the design and style of this bikini.  I bought the size that corresponded with my size, but unfortunately, the top I received was a bit small.  However, the bottoms fit perfectly.  I guess this comes with the territory when you buy a top and bottom together as one size instead of being able to pick the size of each piece independently.

It took to the water well, and dried fairly quickly when left hanging.

The material feels a bit thin and coarse to the touch, but it is surprisingly comfortable to wear.  Unfortunately, I won't be wearing this to the beach any time soon, unless there's some weight loss involved to get the top to fit.  I'm disappointed, because it is super cute, and my husband says I look super cute in it.

DISCLAIMER:
I received this product from the seller at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

I've lost ~90 lbs in the last 12 months and for the first time in my adult life, I decided to take the leap and try this two-piece. I freaking LOVE IT. I was seriously anticipating just getting a good laugh seeing myself in the mirror, but I was shocked at how flattering this suit is (5'3, 170 lbs, 36B). The ruched bottoms disguise any lumps or bulges, the top fits well and is very supportive and comfortable. The top is *rather* padded though, so while that works for me, just be aware... The bottoms fit well, they don't roll down when I walk around or sit in them for a while. Seriously, if you're considering purchasing a bikini-style suit but you're just not sure you're confident enough to rock it, try this one. I can't wait to hit the beach for the first time this season! I would like to disclose that I received this product at a discounted price in return for my unbiased review, but don't let that scare you; I'm definitely buying at least one more of these suits at the regular price in another color!

So, I have always been a plus size woman, even in early adulthood. Every time I've tried a diet I've thought "this is the year I wear a bikini". It's never happened. I'm not almost 35 and decided several months ago to change my eating habits and diet, and have developed a love of the gym. I've also been a roller derby player for 5 years now. I started losing inches the past few months and when I saw this I thought "ah, what the heck." I didn't think I'd be able to wear it till summertime (I mean, I live in Colorado so obviously I wouldn't be able to), but I figured I'd get it now to see how much more I need to lose. I was pleasantly surprised to discover that I could wear it now if it wasn't blizzarding outside right now. :) The color is really pretty, the material is not flimsy at all, and the top fits my 38 in-between-C-and-D cups. The back and top of the top tie, and I do wish that the back was a hook or something else a little easier to connect, but that's probably just because I'm not used to bikini tops since I've never worn one before. I ended up posting a pic of me in this when I tried it on because I was so excited about it, and got rave reviews from friends and family. It's worth the money, beyond worth it. The bottom is snug enough to feel secure (and I have a large behind naturally), and the front has some sort of design I am not sure what it's called that hides tummy (which I still have for now). I love this suit. I have several friends who ordered it just because it looks so great. One thing though, as everyone else has said, ORDER TWO SIZES UP. I based my original size as a Large (12/14) which is what I'm currently wearing and upped it twice to an XXL and it is PERFECT. So make sure you do the same. I would give this suit a thousand stars if I could. :)

I received this product at a discount for my honest and unbiased review, but that doesn't mean I give everything I receive 5 stars. If I don't like something, I say so. Why would I post a pic of me in this suit if I didn't like it? :)
summary: You will wish it's already summertime

reviewText: I really like this bathing suit.  The print is very feminine. The reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because the bottoms could stand to be just a bit thicker material.  I don't think it will hold up for as long as a suit with thicker material.  But, overall I really like the look and fit of it.  I am very glad I read the reviews ahead of time so I could make sure I ordered a large enough size.  I love how this covers up my stretch marks from having babies.  It has great coverage.  I think the top is really pretty.  It seems like a little higher quality than the bottoms.  But, I think that is because of the padding.  It's not warm enough here to go swimming yet, but I did try the suit out in our hot tub.  I am glad I made this purchase. reviewText: I've had past disappointing experiences with buying swim suits from Amazon (mostly because I didn't read reviews or there weren't any to begin with), and this one is a total game changer. Of course I learned from my mistakes and read the reviews (more times than I'd like to admit) before buying this suit for its cheap price. When I read the reviews I saw many people advise to order two sizes up, I was a little skeptical and a little nervous to order a large since I'm a size small. So instead I got a medium, it fits pretty fine except for the boob area. I'm 5'2" with 34A cups. The only problem I had was the boobs, and it's not even that big of a problem. It's just a little too narrow and if I move a great deal I'll probably suffer from a nip slip. However if you're a pretty lean build, short as in like 5'3" and shorter, and naturally a small/xsmall with smaller breasts, medium will be perfect for you. Also the material is amazing, I'm no expert but as a competitive swimmer it feels like any other practice suit material.

reviewText: I bought this in size small. I'm 5'1 and 93-98 lbs. The stomach area is a little loose for me and I need to wear a push-up bra to make the upper chest fuller (I'm an A cup though so I'm not surprised), but overall the dress is super gorgeous and cute. I usually have a stomach (I'm not one of those flat-stomach girls) so the loose fabric isn't too bad for me. The cap sleeve is sheer and adorable, and the dress is not see-through so it's safe to wear and made of nice quality fabric. It's flowy and feminine and falls a bit above my knees. The inner lining (dress?) is made of a silk-ish material and feels nice. There is a weird thing though; underneath the black, middle band, there will be slight bulging as the seam for the torso and the skirt part of the inner dress are sewn together there. Because the dress is loose for me, there is no bulging, but I pulled it taut to see what happens and it creates a line all around your waist. It's not a problem because the black middle part covers it, but it's a sheer black and if someone looks hard at you, they'll probably notice it. Overall, it's a beautiful dress and I'm wearing it to my college graduation!

reviewText:
First, from the photo, I thought the pink color would be more orangey/salmon, but it is actually a true pale pink. Not bad looking, but not what I wanted.

More problematic for me: it was too tight across the chest, but fit in the shoulders/arms, so I didn't want to go up a size. Also, I think this would be most flattering on someone with a relatively small chest--the fabric drapes nicely on the hanger, but on me, it billowed out in front, completely obscuring my waist and making me look very round. Maybe it could work with a belt?

Quality seemed pretty good, though, so it would be a nice top for someone else.
It's small af and perfect for a party at Wet Republic. Or Coachella. Or grandma's birthday BBQ.
It's kinda loose

I'm pretty big on how a bag will help you in the task at hand. I find if the pockets are too lose or don't have enough room that you're wasting your time with trying to load it up with stuff to carry. I don't like the idea of in the middle of a trip, stuff starts tumbling out onto the floor of your car depending on where you're at and how you're using the bag. Something else I've always been very strict on is how the straps work, feel, and are constructed.

This messenger bag has a very nice feeling strap and the closure of the bag is a nice leather with magnetic latches. Something else that I appreciate is that the main compartment of the bag has a zipper to keep it closed. So you don't have to worry about the contents spilling out everywhere.

They say this bag is for both men and women, but in my opinion, it feels like it would be better suited for a woman. For me personally, I would prefer to have a bag with padding to carry my tablet or laptop. The canvas constriction is very nice and I think it will last for a long time. I would have liked to see the inside of the bag be a lighter color to make it easier for people to find items laying inside of the bag.

First off, no one gave me a discount for this review. I bought this bag because it's cute, leather, doesn't have any stupid/tacky/sparkly "embellishments", and holds my MacBook. It could probably also hold my dog, a small child, and a sofa. It's big. It's also awesome. My only complaint is the lining seems a little cheap, but for the price, I can live with that.
There's a small zipper pocket on the outside, and the usual side pocket on the inside. Thing is, the inside pocket is actually 3 pockets: the zipper pocket, then an open pocket on the outside of that, and the outside of the open pocket is another zipper pocket. The other side has two open pockets. I'm pretty happy about all this pocket business.
In all, I'm so happy with this purchase that I'm actually taking the time to write a *positive* review.

First of all, the anklets were very pretty. I ordered 2 that were slightly different styles and I was excited to wear them. I have to wear a uniform to work and it's super plain but the good news is the bottom of it is a skirt so I was looking forward to having something cute to wear with it. So now the bad news... The anklet randomly broke after being at work for only 2 hours. My co-worker actually found it on the ground and gave it to me. I'm a cocktail waitress at a resort so I walk around a lot all night, but nothing I do should have caused it to just fall off so quickly.

When I got home I was able to take a closer look at it and quickly noticed one of the end pieces where the clasp was had broken off. I probably could have easily had it fixed but the price was so low I figured oh well I'll just wear the other one tomorrow night. So the next night I wore the second one but this time it fell off after about 20 minutes at work. I I looked around and found it pretty quickly in the middle of the floor again  and sure enough  the same exact thing happened!

Two things,  first; the saying you get what you pay for is So true with these anklets. They were very poorly  made. Secondly, I noticed that the clasp used to hold it together was way too small for the anklet. It actually looked like it was from a necklace or bracelet made for a child. I could see why it probably just pulled apart super easy. So unless you're into buying disposable jewelry I would strongly recommend paying a little bit more for a better quality piece of jewelry. Very disappointing. '

reviewText: This shirt was perfect and received it on time.
I love this blouse.  It fits as expected and is comfortable.  Love the black buttons.  Price  is right, too.

I had to look around a lot to find a tuxedo shirt cut for a woman.  This one fits almost perfectly, except the sleeves are a bit long.  The material is not too thin, but not super thick either; the pleating in front offers more coverage. Unless you plan on wearing a jacket or an undershirt, certain color bras might show through the fabric.

  Also, not sure what the deal was with mine, but the shirt had quite a few stray threads that I needed to trim off before wearing it.  Fortunately, none of the seams look like they are fraying or coming apart, it just looked a little sloppy out of the packaging.

  The buttons on this shirt are a bit strange to me, but I guess it is meant to offer flexibility: the shirt has two sets sewn on.  The topmost button on the collar is white.  The next four buttons down allow you to pick between smaller black buttons and white buttons.  The last three buttons are white, but it appears as though there are only two button holes, so you can't button up the very bottom one. (Maybe it is meant as a spare? It's far enough down so it will be tucked in, so doesn't really matter.)  The cuffs can be worn buttoned (just the white buttons on the cuffs) or with cuff links.  I noticed that when I wore it with all the white buttons showing, the shirt had a little bit of a wrinkle near the bottom, like the cloth is aligned slightly off when it is worn that way.
summary: Fits well, but had a good deal of stray threads that needed to be cut off.

reviewText:
When these gloves first arrived I was very impressed.  The fit is generous (definitely on the large side), and the cool-mesh design provides lots of airflow yet still completely covers the hands for sun protection.  I've also learned they dry out very quickly if you have to ride in the rain.

The bad news:  After wearing these for only about a month (roughly 2,500 motorcycle miles including two overnight trips and daily commuting to work), they're falling apart.  On the under side of the gloves, the elastic band is coming apart at the seam from the palm.  Similarly, the top side of the gloves are coming apart at the seem in the webbing between the thumb and first ringer.  Also, the outer layer of mesh is really starting to fray.  It's a shame - I really liked these gloves when they first arrived, but they're just not holding up that well.
summary: The bad news: After wearing these for only about a ...

reviewText: I've purchased a few leggings from this company and have loved them all. They were all labeled as high waisted, but only one truly was, but the others were fine. They also all had the tag "Leggings Depot" on the product when it arrived. However, I was disappointed this last time. I ordered the purple paisley, mixed pattern, color #NCPRX1231. When it arrived, the first thing I noticed was that it shipped from leggings depot, as expected, but the product had the tag "Always" "Plus Size" on it. Unlike the others, it was not their brand. No biggie. When I went to try it on, the waist band fit a bit snug. I'm a 16W or 18 misses. If I was a size bigger, these would not fit me at all. And the major disappointment was the pattern. I fell in love with the pattern online, but the pair I received had huge gaps between the different floral/paisley squares. Some of which weren't symmetrical. It was a huge disappointment and I am sending this pair back. All the others were a love from this company and all were very soft and nice, including these.
summary: Might Be Hit and Miss with this company

reviewText: I love these leggings! They are so comfy & buttery soft! I would give 5 stars but I  think it's a stretch to call these plus size. I am 6-8 petite pants. I ordered these based on other reviews. I don't like my leggings really tight, so these were perfect. I guess high waist means not low rise. These hit me right at the waist. They run very small.

I'm a bit disappointed in these leggings. They are supposed to be plus sized, but they definitely do not fit like other plus sized leggings do. I wear a size 18 pants, and when I put these on, I snapped the seam thread in the bottoms of both legs and one line in the waist. I do have big calves, but I was still sad that this happened. I took the thread out of the bottoms and just wear them 'unfinished,' but I wish they weren't sewn so tight in the first place. The thread is a little thin, it wasn't difficult to snap it by just pulling it between two hands. They are a little tight everywhere, and as such I get a small "muffin top" around the waist. I am a pear-shaped person, and usually that's not something I have a problem with. The print is cute, and I did get compliments when I wore them. If I hadn't snapped the thread I would have sent them back. Not so great for the self-esteem :(.
summary: Not really plus-sized, in my opinion.

reviewText: I bought 3 of these one in green, mint, and white. the sizes are way off for US sizes. These are from China, they are beautiful shirts and the quality is very good. I gave the white one to my daughter she wears a size 8-9 in womens so med-to lg in shirts and it was just a tad bit big on her, the green I gave to my mother and she says it fits perfect, shes about 150 pounds and 4 ft 9. I suggest if you are a 3x to 4x do not buy it will not fit. I love the clothes from China but they are way to small for plus size women.

They have enough spandex to smooth things out but because they're mostly cotton, the dull finish will hide any imperfections- I can't stand workout pants that are too thin or shiny. I ordered another style of the same brand and they fit the same. I'm not a fan of the grey color though- it's lighter than I imagined but still fit great. reviewText:
These dresses will all get 4 stars from me because of the great style, high quality (if not the most desirable) fabric, good construction and GREAT pricing. However, they do have their drawbacks.
--Material: It's a slick polyester, really too heavy for summer wear (in a summer dress), rather like a lightweight swimsuit material--I don't care for it at all but just can't pass up the dresses at the price.
--Sizing: Despite the stretchiness, IMO, dress is about one size too small. I've got a pear-shaped body and am usually a US size 2X/20 in UK and European clothing, 3X in Torrid and most clothing made in China--plus sizing seems to be all over the place, there is no standard. But I did figure 3X in these dresses would fit well. Not so--a little too snug for my liking across the waist and stomach area, although plenty full through the hips. One other thing--I was glad I bought several colors because some were cut a little larger than others and did fit great.
--Also wish the neck were cut a little lower like their tank-style dresses.
--Length is too long--a couple of inches below the knee if you're under 5' 4".
--Unless the dress is offered in Prime, it can take up to 3 weeks to be delivered (from Hong Kong).
summary: Terrific dresses with a few drawbacks

reviewText: Quality product. Made in Texas!  Ratchet type is what I should have purchased long ago to keep from having split-leather belts from splitting.  the ratchet keeps from putting any stress on the belt so it should last a lifetime.

The metal buckle is stylish (and many choices.)  Its teeth firmly holds the belt thing which can be easily cut to fit.  An illustrated instruction note
is provided. Overall, the feel, color and budget price are very inviting. Recommended.

I completely am loving my new belt. Perfect length and quality. From now on I think I am sticking to only getting these types of adjustable belts. The only issue is that I ordered the BS0091-Black and received the  BS0081-Black which is a different buckle. However I loved this buckle as well, thus I am keeping it. But for future consideration, I would definitely prefer I got the right order.

You won't find a more beautiful buckle selection ANYWHERE!! I am amazed at the quality of the material and workmanship on these belts for the price!!! I have to question those who say theirs didn't work because the ratchet mechanism is very simple and not much to go wrong. And if it really doesn't work, nice thing about Amazon, you can always return for money back or exchange. I guarantee you won't be disappointed with any of these belts. (And NO, I do not work for or represent Mooniva or Amazon). Just praising a great product.Mooniva Men's Leather Ratchet Belt Moxiguo Collection Large (36" to 38") Black
summary: You won't find a more beautiful buckle selection ANYWHERE

The best thing about the belts is the ratchet mechanism.  You can change the size by moving the belt (how great after a big Thanksgiving dinner). reviewText:
Nice belt, good looking, appears to be of good quality, but only time will tell, so 4 stars for now and if it holds up to test of time, will update review.
Important, be sure not to cut belt too short as the notches that lock belt into place don't go all the way to end of belt.  I almost cut the length too short.

This is a great product.  The belt buckle itself looks very sharp, and Mooniva should take advantage of opportunities to develop buckles specifically targeting interest areas (sports, hobbies, etc), or organizations (e.g., make something with an eagle, globe and anchor correctly aligned and I can point you to a predictably eager clientel....).  The belt itself is a great improvement on the traditional design. Here's an answer to the problem of cracked or discolored leather that suffers the extra wear of the buckle's bar and prong. I will be interested to see how the ratchets themselves hold up over time...but whatever the case, any wear that does develop will not show.  Top it all off with a price that beats the average, and it's not hard to endorse this accessory.

Overall a nice dress and the image colors are pretty close to what I received. In the picture it looks like the top portion color matches one of the stripes on the bottom portion but it is off by a few shades in real life. The top is closer to a light peach and the pink stripe is a bit darker than the photo. It is a rayon type material and feels good on and is not see-through. I am 5'7, 120 lbs and am very flat chested (size 36 A) and it fits me perfectly on top. It is a bit stretchy so a slightly bigger person could easily get away with this size, although it would be more form fitting. The only draw back was the length, I was shocked at how long it was, which is better then to short. I had to cut about 4 inches off the bottom. When I first cut it off I thought I was going to have to re-hem it but due to the type of material, it sort of curls up at the bottom and I am okay with the look.

Love my top !

Upon opening the package I thought this top would be too small, but this is the most flattering top I have bought in a long time!  It is so difficult to find decent tops that are mostly cotton that can be worn in southern climates (91 degrees today and very humid on the Gulf coast).  The amazing part is the spandex and thicker cotton fabric are comfortable while providing a silhouette that compliments curvy ladies.  The bust just fits me, but has enough give in the fabric to be comfortable (great for busty girls, I am 45").  The fabric curves in and is tighter under my bust and gives me a waistline with tummy control, and still covers my derrire.

I haven't washed it yet, but plan to wash on hand-wash cycle in cold water, and gently stretch to shape before hanging or lay flat to dry. Will let you know how it retains its shape. That will be the final test, but I do LOVE this top and recommend highly even though I paid full price!
summary: Very flattering top, cotton to stay cooler and a little spandex to hold in your tummy!

reviewText: Had a tough time getting this over my shoulders, although it fit everywhere else once it was on. It was a nightmare to get back off though, so I didn't want to keep it.

This is a cute romper, especially for the price but there are several "red flags" to be aware of. First of all, I ordered a Large. It does say that the item runs small for US sizes. (Well, fix the sizing on the ad posting and you'll save everyone time and aggravation!)  They did not have an X Large, so I thought I'd get the Large and take a 50/50 chance it would fit. I gained weight (23lbs) for the first time in my life so I'm determined not to buy anything but a few things for a trip in a month. Anyway, I am 5'31/2", weigh roughly 155lbs. I have always had large breasts (I'm a 36 DD-36 DDD now, when I weighed around 128-135 I was a Size 32-34 D), have small hips and thin legs but carry extra weight in my mid section. I couldn't get the romper over my thighs. So you get the idea. The Large isn't even close to a US Large. Second flag, the fabric is sheer. You will definately be able to see ur bra and panties. The front is a V, completely open, (kind of like an opening u would get from a wrap around dress that's cut to low), so regardless of your size, you will either completely show your bra, (larger chests will "push" out the opening even more), will have to wear something under it (will look awful with this style), or pin it which you ll def see and will mostly still be open.  The print on the fabric is okay, nothing special.
summary: price great, may be cute on teenagers but though it appears attractive for an older group, noooo..skip it!

I could barely get this past my butt and once I did it was so small I was struggling to breathe. reviewText: So cute and fits really well! I was extremely nervous as I've never had good luck ordering clothes online like this. I am super excited about how cute it turned out and the quality is actually a lot better than expected! I'm about 5'3" 120-125 lbs and I ordered a medium because I didn't want it to be too short or too tight!

I have never worn a romper before, but after wearing this one, I think I may purchase more in the future. The material is very soft and comfortable. After reading reviews of the others that had a very low cut neckline, I decided to go with the option that had a snap around the chest area, to provide a little more support and coverage. I am 53  and 111 lbs, so I wasn't sure whether I should choose a small or medium, but I went with a medium. The small would have fit as well, but the medium gives me a little more room to move around, whereas I think the small would have been a bit tighter. It is personal preference, but for me, I did not want something too tight. The medium feels great on me. I am looking forward to wearing this more often in the warm months.

reviewText: I had ordered a medium and received an extra large. Therefore, I was not able to use this swim suit and had to return it. I ended up going with a couple other ones I had been trying out.  I do have to say that the material seemed good quality. However, the crochet material was not stretchy. Therefore, getting the right size is very important with this one. After testing several Meaneor tops for reviews, and finding that they fit me nicely, I found this dress, and wanting a basic black dress to have on hand, I purchased it.  I wear a size 16 and so chose the XL. The sleeves are form fitting, but the dress itself is amply large and falls nicely.

Since I am smaller in the bodice than others, this fit me more as a high waist than a true empire, but it looked lovely none the less. The polyester blend does require a slip, and runs just a tiny bit long for my shorter 5' 4" frame. Not too long, just long enough I have to be careful going up stairs. So, if you are taller, this will be long enough for you. I especially love dressing it up with colorful accents (which is why I was looking for a basic black). With this neckline, you can wear jewelry or a scarf.

All in all, I have found the Meanor products to be a very nice value. Shipping takes awhile (since it comes from China), so be sure to allow ample time. No instant purchase, but well priced, and if you follow their measurements posted, well fitting and decently made.

We were getting ready to go to a 50s dance hall. My friend would have preferred the dress in red, but they didn't have red in size XXXL. I ordered that size for her, because she's gained a few pounds and I worried about it being too small for her and her not having anything to wear to the dance. It turned out to fit perfectly, but was slightly big on her. She's a little over 200lbs and is 5'9" with DD cups. She ordered sea green, because she wanted the dress to match her eyes. The green was a bit darker and not so flattering when it arrived in the mail, and although my friend expressed gratitude, I knew she would have preferred the red. She said next time, she will get a red in one size smaller, an XXL. (For this dress, I gave the review 4 stars).

Comment for my blue with white polka dotted dress in size XXL (fit exactly as expected): The dress arrived two years ago in the mail almost immediately after I ordered it. I tried it on and it fit like a glove. It was the most beautiful dress I ever owned, and I ordered a blue petticoat to go with it. It fit perfectly in the bosom, waist, back and side area and it was the perfect length and cut along the bust area. The sleeves were perfect as was the fabric, the color, and every other thing about it. I was a size 14 then with a 36A bust, standing at 5'6" and 175lbs. I gave this dress review a five stars for my dress.

Advantages:

She normally wears a size 2. I bought a size 4 and it is VERY tight. I've just ordered a 6, but I'm fearful the 6 will be too big. Based on the fit of the first dress, I'd say the sizing runs one-and-a-half sizes too small. Other than the sizing being off, it's a great dress - especially for the money.

First thing we noticed upon opening the package is the smell. It does smell weird (fishy like my son's hermit crab food). The dress looked nice, the ruffles on the front falls/drapes as pictured. But the ruffles at the back are not evenly sewn. If you inspect it closely, you'll notice more imperfection with the stitching. This won't matter if you are using this for a night time affair. However, the scary part if that there are "hand sewn?" stitches reinforcing the lacing loops. We are unsure if it (chiffon lace and loops) will be able to last the upcoming event. The dress is bigger than expected. We tried lacing it up tightly, but still loose on the bodice bra part. We decided to return it.
summary: Dress drapes as pictured but has a funky smell

reviewText: This is my handy make up and jewelry case and I love it! However, its only going to work well if you are doing light application of make up. This is not for those travel times when you need to put on the full arsenal of make up.  When I take this I am only packing powder and brush, mascara, eye liner pencil, brow pencil, an urban decay eye shadow pallet (which takes up too much room), one lip stick, and/or one lip gloss. I sometimes squeeze in blush and brush, but usually I don't bother. If I leave out the huge eye shadow pallet I could fit blush and foundation with their brushes easily. So the make up part is pretty full, but there is still room in the back compartment to store some key jewelry accessories too, like a couple or earrings, necklaces and rings. I am pretty particular about how jewelry is stored and I have to say I am pretty pleased with all the dividers to protect your good jewelry from getting scratched or tangled. I recently went out of town for travel and this backpack was used as part of the packing. Though it is not the largest backpack I have seen and used, it is a very good one and I really like it. There is only one thing about it that I would suggest as an improvement.

This is a heavy canvas bag with leather trim elements that is designed to hold up under heavy use. The canvas material is very thick and heavy, the stitching is strong and overall the whole bag is assembled well. I have found no issues with loose threads, uneven seams or crooked materials.

The main compartment is large and deep and is sufficient for holding most laptops. There is even a divider inside that is good for keeping a laptop or tablet separate from the rest of the open area. Now, that said, this bag offers little in the way of padding so while it is set up for carrying a laptop it is not ideal for such. It is also not heavily reinforced on the bottom (though there is some extra enforcement that can be felt on the bottom if you feel inside) and this is the one area where I believe this bad could be improved: a leather layer on the bottom would add strength and make it last longer.

In addition to a drawstring-style closure, the main compartment can be covered by a flap sewn on the bag that snaps down when folded over the main compartment. This flap actually snaps down and does not use magnets like I have seen in a lot of other bags, and while this is worth mentioning it is neither positive nor negative.

This bag has multiple zippered pockets: one on each side of the outside of this bag and two small pouches on the inside. Each of the zippers on the outside are metal and they seem to work well and very smoothly. The inside zippers are plastic but they also seem to be very smooth in operation.

There are actually two dividers inside this bag so in theory you can carry two laptops as well as books and keep everything separate. While possible, it is not advisable.

Overall, this is a nice, heavy duty bag that is made very well. I like the construction, the appearance and the feel. If I could change one thing I would reinforce the bottom of the bag; otherwise, this bag is a solid offering.

Disclaimer: I was provided a sample of this product in exchange for a fair, honest and thorough review. Even though I received this product at no cost I have rated and reviewed this product without bias, based solely on my experience with it.

The fabric of this top is amazing.  It is extremely soft, almost silky like. The top has padding in it similar to the removable ones in a bikini top, but better.  Unlike other shirts I've seen in the past that have these inserts, you cannot see the outline of them at all in this top.  They actually seem larger than most, where they feel as though they take up the entire width of the portion that covers your breast.  They do not appear to be accessible for removal or anything but you also can not even tell that it has them simply by looking at the top.  It was not until i actually felt it and put it on that i realized.  It is great because you obviously can not wear a bra, nor do you need to with the thickness of the fabric/ lining.  The fit is perfect and actually provides a little more coverage over the breast area than I expected, but not too much of course.  Very sexy top and extremely comfortable and of course you can't beat this price. reviewText: Here's a suggestion: if you guys are going to be selling these bathing suits to American consumers how about you make American sizes and not Asian sizes. Gosh what a novel idea. I received this product free of charge in exchange for a review.

Existentialism aside, it's a good product. The band fits really well, I like the sleek black and white look and face of it isn't boring.  It was easy to set and doesn't slide around. Cool watch, weird philosophy, good product.
