reviewText:
I received a discount for this item in exchange for an honest review.

I'm not one to usually accessorize, as I live a pretty active lifestyle that constantly accelerates the wear-and-tear of items, but the design of this watch really grabbed at me.

When I received the watch I took a liking to the overall aesthetic; it had an outdoorsy look with the matte-black industrial design that incorporated an intricate tree and a peace sign hybrid without alienating its ability to be worn in professional settings.

The watch's bands are of a sturdy make that actually fit around my wrist, which is great for individuals with large wrists. I took it to the gym for a test run and it never became a hindrance. The watch stayed securely in place and didn't pinch my wrists like other watches have done. The white numbering also made it easy to read and time my late-night running.

In the end, I plan on recommending this watch to my trendy-minded friends and my physically-active friends alike. I was really happy with this watch and look forward to wearing out more.

Coming from someone that wears a watch mainly for the fashion and not necessarily the time, I totally identify with this brands mindset and love the idea behind these watches meaning something more. Their tagline says "Stop worrying. Start Being." - A quote we should all keep in mind as we go about our daily lives.

The black on black looks trendy and expensive, and I like that I can purchase multiple colored bands. It would be awesome if you could switch the colored bands in and out! The graphic on the face of the watch adds a quirky flair that represents something more than a plain old watch. The dial to set the time is on the top, directly above where the 12 would be, hidden almost under the band, which could be cumbersome for some, but I like that it isn't visible to the naked eye. It makes the watch appear more sleek.

For those that like to stand out and also have an appreciation for art, this is a great watch and conversation piece/peace. I have already received compliments on it, and once you explain what it means people love it even more. I plan on purchasing more and adding to my Time-Peace collection.  I received this product as a free promotional item in exchange for my review.

Highly recommend!

I got this watch in an exchange for a review. So far I like it! I love the way it looks and feels. It's not too heavy like some watches are. I love the design and the after the explanation for the design I like it even more. The only problem I had was where the knob thing is to set the time. It's on the top of the watch and it's hard to get to with the band there. Which might go along with the theme of the watch but it will be pain to set every time it dies.

I got this watch in exchange for a review. I love it. It has a beautiful aesthetic and it's very modern. I've been looking for a new watch and this one really fits my personality. It got here very fast and it's made of a very soft, comfortable material. I recommend it highly.

reviewText: bought it for my daughter she loved it

This is another great shirt that Oakley stopped making.  What is with Oakley and UA turning out great products and then rapidly ceasing production a-la "fast fashion".  This is a polyester workout/casual shirt that is lightweight, soft, has good wicking and almost perfect cut for athletic movement.  It's a great shirt to lift weights, play basketball or kick back and watch TV in.  The medium fit true to size (5'11" 175lbs).  I have a black one that was almost too short in the body, but otherwise perfect fit.  The blue one that I got on Amazon (after realizing Oakley quit production), pleasantly, had a longer body but the same chest, arms, neck, and overall cut.

I also own the two closest shirts in Oakley's current lineup that seem to have succeeded this shirt.  They both are less comfortable (not as soft, not cut quite the same) and one is actually cut in such a way that make athletic movements feel restricted, particularly in the arms.  This older, out of production shirts beats its replacements hands down.

If you can find one in your size, I highly recommend it as a comfy workout or even lightweight casual shirt. That said, the one I received from the Amazon seller did seem to be a "2nds" quality.  It had several threads that were starting to run and the bottom body hem, besides running, seemed to have somehow been "shaved" and after the first wash, the whole hem is coming undone.  I own a black and grey one and didn't have the loose strings/hem problem on either of those (those were purchased from Oakley direct and Galls, respectively.  Also, the amazon purchase, while appearing new, didn't have the tags and original packaging that the other 2 did.

But, with Oakley ceasing production, slim pickins are left.  It's a great shirt, if you can find one.
summary: This is another great shirt that Oakley stopped making

I am pleased with the linen fabric of these pants,or divided skirt, or whatever one might call them. The sewing, esp on the lace panels is excellent, however, I do wish there were pockets, side seam or even visible ones. The lace edge is hemmed with a strip of the main fabric on the inside and the top of the lace panel is edged with a closely matching fabric tape which is a nice touch. I gave this 4 instead of five stars for the placement on the lace as every time I wear this, the lace gets caught on something, like a coffee table corner or something on the ground. It brings me to a quick halt as I don't want the lace to tear. My size was actually only a little small, since the style is so loose and has lots of fabric anyways. It's just the elastic waist is a bit tight getting it on as a pull-on style.. I have tried gathering up the sides of the legs a bit and it adds a sweeter look, the full fabric almost looks like bows. Then it looks more like what I wanted -- a vintage-looking divided skirt. I may wear ankle boots with it or some cotton leggings with ruffles if it isn't too costumish. I haven't tried washing these yet, but I don't see a problem since I hand wash a lot of my linen clothes.
summary: Sweet-looking, flowy, supple linen WIDE pants are easy to love!

reviewText: I've been looking for a romper for 3 to 4 years now this was the only one that I bought ever that actually fits me I'm about 5'6" 145-150 and the medium fit really well. I think the fabric is a little weird but nothing to be concerned about and the previous reviews about having to pull the top over your shoulders is true. I bought these shoes for my 5 year old son. They were the closest thing I could find to a pair of beloved Nikes that he had completely worn through.
I like the elastic/vecro combination. The bright colors (blue and yellow) were just want he wanted, too. The "ventilator"  the fact that the fabric is a mesh  is fine for summer, spring and fall, but these wouldn't make a good winter shoe. I like the way the rubber sole comes up a bit over the toe. I bought this tshirt for my daughter's birthday. After reading reviews about sizing I decided to go with the juniors size Large, though my daughter was currently comfortable in a child's size large/10-12 or XL shirt. The size was perfect! A bit longer than kids' shirts so it came down well past the waist of her pants but width-wise it was just snug enough without being too tight.

She's been wearing this t-shirt weekly for over a year now and it has held up excellent in the wash. No fading/peeling of the logo and no pilling on the shirt. She gets compliments on it all the time wherever we go. I wish it were easier to find Harry Potter merchandise in kids' sizes so the conversion between juniors wouldn't be such a guessing game. Soon this one will be outgrown and passed down to her little sister, and we'll be back in search of another!
summary: A great shirt, small fit due to junior sizing.

It hits right at the bottom of my butt cheeks, waist tie hits at the waist and the hood is a nice depth, not shallow with risk to fall down as you walk (I hate that with other jackets!). Just wish I ordered a small but having it tailored might be cheaper than returning and exchanging.

reviewText: This is such a luxurious soft silky tank.  I'm so glad I read the other reviews, because I usually wear a size M, but in these lovely silk tanks I wear an XL.  Perfect.
These are just great.  I just love them!!

I bought this black in XL some time ago and could not imagine living without two more in black (and some other colors that have not yet arrived), in same size, XL.  There are so many black tanks out there, so why this?  Well, I think it's the cut and the cut for me.  I am 5.5 with what I think to be a shortish torso, weight about 145 lbs., 38C, fat waist, average hips.  Many tanks are too low in the neck for modesty and too long in the body, makes me look more out of shape than I am, and have to tuck in if using for work which worsens the fat waist issue. This one, perfect.  All silk, I am wearing right now.  Am going to sink-wash it with a dab of shampoo.  Considering trying other products from same company made from same strong silk.  For me this is the greatest tank for work (under blazer, cardigan) that I have tried in my modern era (after turning 40, haha; now, in '60s.)  So you pay couple bucks more and get a real garment that unless you need LONGER, will turn back the clock for you!
summary: Love this so much I can't even stand it.

reviewText:

Aside from the sizing, I have no complaints. The color is a lovely turquoise and the silk jersey smooth and generous with the thread count. It's good quality.

reviewText: I am normally a 1x but I ordered a 3x after reading the reviews and it was not big enough. Also the suit is cute but it's not the suit in the picture! Came in what looked like a used zip lock quart size bag. Returning.

The picture shows a skirt that is able to have quite a bit of flounce to it.  This is not the case.  The dress is A line from neck (think triangle).  I'd say it gives about 1/3 of the diameter of the bottom of the skirt show in the picture.  There are several other submitted pictures.  It was cut tighter to the waist than expected, but was still A line.  Much more traditional A line than the picture overexertion which looks comfortable for even ballet moves or martial arts! The orange color is accurate.  It has a nice liner to it so it's not see through (There are 2 layers, a see through one and thick fo-satin material).  Both layers are true to color and both are cut to the same A line. The satin layer stops 6 inches or so before the see through layer (midcalf). There were no care instructions on the tag.  There wasn't even a designer's name on the tag, just the cotton tag with the size at the neckline.  The neckline is tighter than expected which causes the lie to be more of a Tshirt lie than a boat-neck, which was fine.  The apertures for the arm holes were snug on my frame, which is a first, especially given the cut of the dress, however this worked well for me as it didn't show my undergarments that way at all.  Worked fine with size DD, but larger may reduce the fit in the top, so be cautious.  As for length it was fine for 5'11 to ankle.  It, of course, doesn't come with the black belt, but instead had a thing cord made of the same see through material.  There are no belt loops, which is fine for an hourglass figure, but may challenge a column or a pear.  Mentioning this for those who may be curious.  I have not washed the item yet and will be dry cleaning it only as I'm in love with the color.  It was a spot on fall orange.  Exactly what I wanted.  This was a knock off and absolutely NOT the photo in the dress, but a recreation.  The photo is not the dress, given the diameter of the bottom.  However they did make it well.  And were mostly correct and I like it!  Edited to include the photos.  One to show the neckline.  One to show the see through layer/over the satin layer, another to show the reduced diameter of the skirt, and lastly to show the belt.  It looks much different in the sunlight, and more like the photo listed than the darker pictures I posted with light from a closet mirror.
summary: Lovely, not quite like the picture however.

reviewText: Love it!!

My fiancé (Chad) purchased two purses for me this Christmas. I personally selected both items prior to his purchasing the gifts. I was very excited to receive this hot pink mini purse. However, the purse that I received is NOT the purse advertised. I have attached a photo of the purse I received... You will see the difference in not only the type of handle, but also the placement of where the handle attaches to the purse.

In addition to the purse handle, the shape of the purse is completely different than the image advertised (see photo). Furthermore, the zoom in feature shows a much different texture than the actual purse received.

I wonder if the original purse was out of stock?! If so, it would have been nice to be notified prior to receiving a completely different purse.

Lastly, I would greatly appreciate receiving the actual purse that I was expecting to receive upon purchase of this item.

I tried it on the evening I received it. It fit very well!!! Very comfortable!! The only thing I would repeat (from a review I had read) is that the zipper should probably be a bit longer - just to make it easier to get on!  I do have a slight fear of ripping the zipper, but so far so good. I swam in it at an indoor pool, then kept it on to ride an exercise bike and do an elliptical workout. I did 30 minutes on each. The bike padding worked well and it was NOT noticeable during the elliptical!! I forgot I even had it on!! It is that comfortable! I definitely would recommend this suit to anyone that is looking for a very good, affordable tri-suit!!

reviewText: works perfect and protects the passport

I am a seasoned traveler for business and pleasure so I know the importance of a passport.

The passport holder I order was the chestnut color since it looked the same as my car leather interior lol

The color is so much better in person than in the  picture.  It doesn't look fake or has that plastic sheen to it either.  It is lightweight too and not bulky at all.

You will notice the smell of the leather holder, it just reeks of freshly tanned hide so you know its the real deal.

I usually try to avoid leather from India because of quality issues i have had in the past but this holder was on point.  No flaws that I could see.

The passport fits a little snug for me because I put all the paper sheets into the slot (oh yeah i have a double page passport remember seasoned traveler) and only have my passport id page showing when you open it up.

The holder has other slot for other items such as id, credit cards, business cards.  They are just multipurpose slots,

There is no RFID protection built into the holder but you really don't need it in my opinion. but YMMV.

Overall I really enjoy my passport holder.  It has the awesome USA emblem on front and holds my passport securely and elegantly.

I did receive a discount to write a honest review of the product.
Beautiful! Feels and looks great. So happy!

Depending on the agent at the airport, they may make you take your passport out of this case when checking in, going through security or boarding your flight. Very durable - no issues yet. Loved it so much, bought it in Black and Chestnut for my sister and her BF!

As a buyer and a reviewer, I value honest reviews.  I firmly believe that reviews are solely for customers who are interested in learning more about a product before deciding to purchase. I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. I was not paid nor compensated to give a good rating or to write a positive review, I give ratings based on my own experience and the performance of the tested product. I never give a five star review based on an expectation from the seller, I only give five star reviews for products deserving of it in my personal opinion.  I often update my reviews if the product exceeds or falls short of my original review at the time of posting. reviewText:
The passport holder comes in a plastic pouch. The plastic is see through..

The color that I chose was a royal blue and the color appears more to be of navy blue. The passport holder has the writing and symbol as shown on a United States Passport. There are no sleeves or compartments on the front or back of the pouch. Inside the pouch, there are two large pockets on the left side of the passport pouch. In these pockets you can easily fit two passports or plane tickets or anything else. On the right side of the pouch, there is one small pocket and two larger pockets. In the larger pockets, there is sufficient size to place the passport into the pockets. The smaller pocket is sufficient to place an ID card to any other cards. The quality of the material is sturdy and good quality. If there is a real sharp object then it may make a scratch on the pouch itself.

Overall, the item is very nice to have in order to protect your passport as well has place other handy items when travelling such as travel documents or ID cards or even plane tickets. .
.
I have received this item at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review for the product. I am in no way affiliated with the seller or product. I write reviews based on previous experience with similar products. I hope you find this review helpful.

reviewText: This swimsuit is so cute!  This is the 3rd swimsuit I've ordered off amazon and this is by far my favorite (the other two I returned).  I read previous reviews and, based on what they said about size, I with a 4XL and it fits pretty well.  So, read the previous reviews and decide the size you need, is my advice. The "dress" part is nice and does not feel cheaply made - it's shear, but not too thin.  the top covers everything I need it to, though the "padding" is a little thin.  I am pear shaped and I feel very comfortable wearing this swimsuit - it hides what I'm insecure about (darn you, love handles!).  It seems to be made well and I cannot wait to wear it on my cruise. :-)

reviewText: Product is exactly as pictured. It is very sheer as you'll see in the included picture. I was pleasantly surprised at the fit of the free size. I'm 5'8" and a size 12 so I definitely am not an Asian one size and I was fully aware that the dress would fit me a little different than the picture. It is short as you can see but not too short to be worn as a dress. I could also see this working as a long tunic with leggings or jeans especially if you are taller than me. Perfect for the summer. Overall I am happy with this set!

The pants were tagged as XXL but the package were the size I ordered; L.  For the price, these are great pants for a trip to the beach.  Yes, the pocket lining is thin, this is good so that you don't get hot.  Yes the pockets are sewn together in the middle with a few stitches.  This is intentional so that you can wear them snug if you choose and the pockets don't gape open and look sloppy.  All it takes is a couple of snips to remove the 4 or 5 threads and they will function like regular pockets.  BUT, I bought these for a trip to Cancun for when I need to wear long pants to look nice and want to stay cool and don't intend to be carrying anything in my pockets.  I have washed them and tried them on afterward and the fit is perfect.  6' tall, 160 lbs and a L is perfect.

I bought this bralette to wear under scoop collar and shear tops, and it is amazing! The straps add a nice touch of minimalistic detail. In addition, this bralette contains inserted pads, which is nice add shape, since there isn't much support.

The product was somewhat small, but, in my opinion, stretchy and small is better than big and loose. Also, it held my boobs and wouldn't allow a nip-slip.

HOWEVER, I would not recommend this product to people with fuller chests. I, myself have a small chest, so I don't need as much support. I suggest that people with larger chest look for bralettes with underwire, as this does not provide much support.

As a mail carrier I have the challenge of having to read small print in sunny conditions. I can't switch between readers and sunglasses constantly while on the road. I found that the Bora sunglasses were a perfect solution. I tried other bifocal sunglasses from the drug store, but they were flimsy and gave a weird distortion when walking. I notice a big difference with these glasses. Firstly the bifocal is nearly invisible. I don't notice the bifocal line which caused blurred vision in other glasses. I like the glass shade it is a smoke grey not so dark that I can't see indoors. I can see better with the Bora sunglasses.  I did not have to adjust what I was reading to be able to see.  I could pretty much look at it normally and be able to read it. No more find the "sweet spot" when trying to read.  The glasses are sturdy and well made. They fit snugly I like the spring hinge. No more constantly putting my glasses back in place. I love them so much I will probably but a second pair just in case I lose them.
summary: Bora bifocal sunglasses have made my job easier.

This belt is amazing. My brother tried to convert me to ratchet belts a few months ago but I was hesitant. I thought they were like the old school fabric belts that I had in boy scouts. I spent decent money on a pair of regular belts around Christmas and while they seemed to be decent quality, they had no durability and began to deteriorate around the holes. After his alcohol fueled testimonial at Easter, I finally took the advice. I won't go back. The whole concept of the ratchet belt is awesome as you can cinch to basically whatever in-between size your waist might be instead of being stuck with only where the holes of a traditional belt are. The quality of the belt buckle alone is worth double the price. The sizing is a little strange and even though the description has it as a 110, the belt itself is actually marked 125 which is apparently what I needed anyway. By far the best belt I have ever purchased. So much so that I bought a second one in a different color.

reviewText: These are gorgeous and sturdy. Very well priced
This bag is gorgeous!! I love hobo bags, the leather is fantastic!
I love my Finley Tote!  It's a great color and holds a ton of stuff.  I love all Hobo bags, they are always great.

I love the softness of the leather and the light weight of this tote.  I really love the deep forest green color, which is the exact color as displayed on line.  It's a great tote with lots of little secret pockets and zippers.  It also has a lot of room for such a light tote.  The only thing I don't love about this tote are the thin handles.  The thin handles hurt your shoulder after prolonged use and if you tend to carry a heavier bag, then it will definitely cut into your shoulder.  A bag this size would look better with thicker handles.  I would have preferred a zipper across the top to keep everything extra safe like the Hobo Vintage Valerie Tote Handbag has.
summary: Beautiful tote, but handles are too thin

Out of all the dresses I've purchased recently, this is by far my favorite. The color is exactly the same as what the photo shows. The lace pattern is beautiful and feminine. There's no way anyone could put this dress on and feel anything but sexy. It's easy to feel that way when the dress is long enough to cover my chunky legs.

As far as the fit goes, the dress fits amazing. It accentuates my chest area, so if you're a large-breasted woman like myself and don't want to draw attention to your chest, this dress may not be the one for you.

The one downside that I did find with this dress is the belt. It's really pretty. I love the buttons. However, while the dress fits me and isn't too snug, this belt doesn't fit as well as I feel it should. It's too tight and the stitching came undone on one of the buttons. Luckily for me I have a very talented seamstress for a friend, and she's convinced we can find material to make me a new belt.

Disclosure: I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for my honest review.

reviewText: The skirt is not floor length as shown in the picture. Im 5'3 and it was short on me.

I've been looking forward to getting this outfit for quite some time. Fits as expected. Images in non-model photos are true to the colors of it. Skirt is a little short - It falls just below my mid shin and I'm 5'5.5". The fabric left something to be desired. It was a synthetic fabric, that's for sure; polyester, I believe. But the kind of polyester that's reminiscent of a table cloth, like it could be wiped clean with a damp towel. I do have to safety pin the cross strings in the back to keep the halter top in a flattering position; I could sew it to fix it, but I probably won't, and it will still look good. This dress is not as bad as other reviews say this outfit is. I'm a size 10-12 (measurements 40-32-38, and I carry my weight in my stomach) and the skirt sits high on my natural waist as I believe it's supposed to do. It fits me, but I probably can't put on anymore weight and have it still fit. The top isn't perfect, but the side-boob I get from it looks good and it wears in a way that I will not be flashing anyone. I can't wear a bra with it, not even one of those front-only bras as it would show on the side. It will need to be washed first to get the square packing wrinkles out of it before public wear. Over all, the outfit is flattering, it's fun, and believe it or not, I think it makes my back fat look sexy! I look forward to wearing it this summer.

 It didn't dawn on me until I tried them on that, if I wash them, I can't return them, so, like I said, I took a chance,  and order 5X.  The waist shrunk about one size, so their a bit big on me but livable.  The legs, which were several inches too long before washing, are now almost too short!
I gave them 3 stars because they are comfortable, a bit like PJs with a lot of pockets. But they don't fit near well enough to wear out in public. They will be good lounge-around-the-house pants but nothing more. I won't be ordering another pair, mainly because of the shrinkage guesswork.

I collect watches like some people collect shot glasses or spoons ... or whatever.  I have expensive ones and cheap ones.  I collect most as novelty or because they are different, my daily wears are pretty plain but reliable and functional.  Whats me point?  This is one of those inexpensive novelty watches.  I haven't had it long enough to vouch for it's reliability but in past experience I wouldn't rely on a watch under $35 if getting a better job relied on it, or to make sure you don't miss your flight.  I love it, it is going in my collection and probably will never be worn. For what that's worth it's just my opinion.

reviewText:
This is a nice looking sweatshirt.  The main problem is that it came smelling rather strongly of smoke.  I did wash it and left it outdoors for two days.  This helped a little, but still has smoke odor.  Perhaps it is due to the polyester fabric.  In addition, this is advertised (and appears) as unisex, but runs small for men.  XL was the largest size available.  I am in the process of determining if a refund is possible, and what that would entail.  It would be a nice sweatshirt for one of my smoking friends. I might consider keeping it if I could get rid of the smoke odor.

I am editing my original review of 3 stars to 4 stars for the following reasons: Even though the company appears to be in China I received very good customer service -- the were very fair.  I was able on the next try (after doing research) to get the smoke out using vinegar with the detergent. The size is a bit small, but I am tall.  At this point, I am happy with my purchase.

Love the watchband. This is my first NATO style band and I like it. I remember my dad having similar band back in the 60s.  My wrist is exactly 7 1/4 inch so I was a little iffy on whether the shorter length would work, but it does work fine with just enough tab left over to fit it in the keeper band. The only thing that is a little odd with a wrist my size and the smaller length band is that the buckle isn't at the exact bottom of your wrist, but a little more towards the outside of the wrist... but it's really of no consequence.

I guess the main thing to say is that these folks seem to have excellent customer service. My first order was for a couple of bands that were the wrong width. So, I returned them. In an extremely timely fashion, my reorder of the correct width was delivered. I've always liked colored watch bands, and these are no exception. If these are the kind of bands you like, order from Barton. You won't be disappointed.

This particular style of sticky bra is so underrated on Amazon. Prior to using this fabric styled sticky bra, I was wasting my money with the super heavy silicone sticky bras. I can recall having worn these silicone sticky bras only about 4 times by the time they began to lose their adhesiveness (possibly because they are just way too heavy maybe?); not to mention, washing them made them even worse to the point where they were unwearable. This fabric style is awesome; I mean trust me on this. I've worn this bra about three times a week for 8 full hours for the past 3 months, and let me tell you, the adhesive is still as adhesive as the first time I wore the bra and washing the bra only makes the adhesive feel like new again (I was afraid it would make it worse). I would recommend rubbing some mild soap on the adhesive side with warm water and all the dirt, lint, fabric, etc. stuck onto it will clump up making it easier to remove all the gunk. I'll be purchasing a black colored one very soon.

These are great for someone like me for a few reasons. I normally never wear normal bras. I love sports bras. The thing about sports bras is that they sometimes are thin, and this means "you know what" sometimes can show. These covers are thin enough that you can't feel a bulge through your shirt, and you don't have to worry about being embarrassed. Another use I've found helpful is if you have nipple chaffing. These will protect your nipples while running or going about your way, so your nipples won't be irritated. I like the variet in this pack, you can use this with a dress, bathing suits, or whatever you want to use it for.

You will need to position your body the way you want it and then stick these in place. I haven't used them a while lot, but you need to keep yourself clean and the silicon adhesive portion clean if you want them to retain their sticking ability for a long time. These feel very much like human skin, so they feel natural.

The only trouble you may have is ordering the right size. I would recommend going up at least a half size to a full size.

Go crazy - and buy yourself a few pairs! What about  your sister - aunt - mother - or friend, too?! They're very afordable, & would make nice "just because I love you" gifts.  Think about it. Have fun!

reviewText: ok

Hi Steven & Lauren
and the Fashion Greek Team...

Just wanted to thank your entire team that had a hand in ensuring my daughter had her "Awesome" Phi Mu X 'Merica delivered and ready to wear to her first high school Homecoming Week. I was unsure what to choose for her day of "America" theme wear...and when shopping I was very proud that I found your shirts on the Amazon website.

Here's where your team went above and beyond the normal expectations of customer support concerning ensuring my daughter received her shirt on time. It seems the shirt I ordered was on back order. I was contacted by Steven who enlisted the help of a fellow Alabama Fashion Greek employee, Lauren...they went right to work to make sure my daughter had not only a shirt to wear for "America Day" at her school. But they also sent her a Special Shirt with her name on the pocket...Bre! Wish I had taken a picture of her face light up when she opened the package and saw that shirt. I hadn't thought to capture that moment. But I will send you guys a picture in her shirts after tomorrow.

Thank you all again for the wonderful care. My daughter loves the quality of her shirts and we now love Fashion Greek!
R.T.

I purchased 3 of these skirts with hopes to wear them solely for the remainder of my pregnancy. They were almost... ALMOST, everything I wanted them to be: They were light-weight, thin and not hot, and in colors that suited my existing wardrobe. I needed to be comfortable and jeans just weren't doing it for me in the last few months.
They arrived in good condition and very prompt. I was very pleased with that.

They were shorter than I wanted, and I expected that to a degree, everything is shorter than I wish it to be (Don't get me started on the barbie-doll-sized counter tops in my apartment bathroom!!). But these were ridiculously short. They came to just below the knee unless I wore them a little lower than normal, but to do that I needed a very long shirt to hide the belly enough to be suitably dressed. They were also too tight. Usually I do not mind a little form fitting, but I am pregnant and I wanted COMFORT and formfitting is not usually comfortable. Neither was it in this skirt; it is very tight. The skirts fit like a regular LARGE size, no where near big enough for a reasonably sized woman in her last trimester. Not. At. ALL. I am very disappointed and crushed really. The reviews warned over size, and I went up as per warning, and it STILL did not work out well for me. All three skirts do not fit at all.

It was so bad I gave them to my 13 yr old daughter. The tags had already been clipped in my desire to try them on without being poked or scratched (I have delicate skin). This was to my detriment and it served as a lesson learned. To have lost all three skirts is really crushing disappointment. She loves the skirts, again they were purchased for their comfort and they do look amazing on her.
Word of caution, they are a little thin in lighted areas. I have her wear a full length slip underneath to help block that a bit. They really are lovely skirts otherwise.

But it fits AMAZINGLY well!!! I adore the fit, form, weight, and comfort it gives me. It is

Beachcoco Women's Maternity High Waisted Fold Over Maxi Skirt size XL

The larger/longer waist allows me to wear it as a normal skirt and it is LONG enough for me! For me, the giant! It comes to my ankles and it is thin and keeps me so cool I've reached for a lap blanket more than once this winter. I love that! It will be PERFECT for summer and wonderful in spring and fall! Its coral, though... I am currently asking them if they will get black and brown and well a few other colors in that size and style since it is SUCH a wonderful skirt! Admittedly I am hypocritically gouache and decline to wear a slip underneath, but it is SO COMFORTABLE!!! Why ruin it?! lol
SO find that better skirt and you should be good to go.
Such a pity I'd found this pathetic skirt first. Go to the link and good luck!!

For the price, they are fine. The materials are cheap plastic but they are rugged and durable; I don't feel like either the tag or loop are likely to break from being thrown around. The plastic loop is attached by plastic nubs on a strip stuck through holes on the other side of the strip, and it has good staying power but can be easily undone compared to other luggage tags. After a good bit of use I've found that the weak spot is that the plastic loops will pop undone every once in awhile if you catch a tag at an odd angle under something heavy, like another piece of luggage, and pry the loop at an odd angle while trying to pick up your luggage out of a pile. It's not a frequent issue but has happened to me twice now, no damage to the tag/loop though. Another downside is that the paper inserts are not protected from rain, which could get to be a pain if you travel a lot. But if you don't mind the risk of one getting lost or ruined, you get 20 of them. And the bright green is nice, true to color in the picture.

A year ago I bought a shirt in light gray for a Halloween costume that I ended up loving so much, I have worn it sense. I sized up for it, and it was perfectly "too big". After reading the reviews back then, I thought I was just lucky.

Just recently I got a job that requires wearing a smock over our clothes, so I figured I would order different colors of the same size for work. Well I got them yesterday.

Each shirt (including the one from a year ago) fits differently and is a different cut. I have a total of five shirts. One is super big. One has longer sleeves. One has a cinched side. And NONE of them fit quite like the other.

 I made the decision to keep them because of what I'll be using them for, but seriously it's a roll of the dice as far as sizing and cut goes. All of the shirts fit me, but all look different. Good luck!
summary: So here is the deal with these shirts.

I used to love all the Gloria Vanderbilt jeans! My closet is full of them but they are different now and not for the better! They used to be 98% cotton and 2% Spandex. They would fit like a glove and no matter what size I was, they were true to size. Now, they have added polyester to many of their jeans-up to 24% in some of them! With polyester, they are heavier and no longer fit as well, nor are they as comfortable.

I would rather pay more for the jeans, capri's and skimmers with the former 98% cotton and 2% Spandex; in order to have the same prior beautiful fit.

Buyer beware!
summary: Watch out for the newly added polyester in some styles!

reviewText: Wow, best fitting casual T's in my collection. Nice material that clings a bit and fits snug in the shoulders and chest and arms but leaves just the right amount of breathing room in the waist for us in shape but not "teenage trim" fellas... Lol I'm 5'9'160 lbs with a 39" chest and 32-33 waist and I usually order a medium but I had to send it back for a large since they run small and it fit amazing. Return was free and easy which was good for them since I own 4 now and keep it in speed dial if I need another color or need more. Go for it!
summary: best fitting casual T's in my collection

reviewText: Comfortable, stylish and simple.  Everything I look for in a piece of clothing.  My only gripe is with the sleeves.  The shirt itself feels slim fitted, which is in no way a bad thing, but the sleeves are very tight.  To give you an idea I am 5'11 180 lbs with a muscular build and I ordered a size large.  If the sleeves were an inch longer the shirt would be perfect.  I've had it 2 days and have already been asked where I bought it.  I highly recommend this product just be sure to order a size up.
